TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
24 XI Millia Virg.
Ondleuene þousend of virgines &punctelev; for ore louerd imartrede were
Telle ichulle of heore martyrdom &punctelev; and ho heom þarto gan lere
A kyng þare was in Brutayne &punctelev; sire Maur was is name
Ane dou&yogh;ter he hadde þat hiet Ourse &punctelev; þat was of noble fame
Cristine heo was and al hire kun &punctelev; swiþe hende and quoynte
So fair womman Men nusten non &punctelev; no so guod in euerech pointe
¶ Of hire fairhede and of hire guodnesse &punctelev; men tolden in eche side
Þat þe word cam into Enguelond &punctelev; and elles&yogh;woder wel wide
A kyng þare was þo in Enguelonde &punctelev; and Man of gret poer
Gret nobleie he heorde telle &punctelev; of þis maide feor and ner
his wille was gret þat is sone &punctelev; þis Maide in spoushod hadde
Ake Men þe &yogh;uyt in Enguelond &punctelev; cristinedom non nadden
¶ Þe king of enguelond, þat was þo &punctelev; to þe kyng of Brutayne gan siende
For is dou&yogh;ter to is sone &punctelev; þat was is heyr so hende
And seide, &yogh;if þat he þarea&yogh;en were &punctelev; þat þe dede nere ido
him and alle his he wolde destruy&yogh;e &punctelev; and al his lond also
Þo þis Messagers comen to þis kyng &punctelev; and heore erinde hadden iseid
Sori and dreori was þis king &punctelev; he ne couþe þareof no red
For þe king of Enguelond &punctelev; was heþene, and alle his
And for he wuste wel þat is dou&yogh;hter nolde &punctelev; iwedded beo, iwis
And also, for þe kyng of Enguelond &punctelev; was of so gret mi&yogh;hte
Þat he no strencþe ne mi&yogh;hte habbe &punctelev; a&yogh;ein him forto fi&yogh;hte
And naþeles Triwes of is answere &punctelev; a&yogh;ein þe messagers he nam
Deol and sor and luyte gladnesse &punctelev; in is heorte þare cam
¶ He ne tolde noþing is dou&yogh;ter fore &punctelev; of þis reuful cas
&YOGH;eorne he bad god ni&yogh;ht and day &punctelev; for he redles was
And criede on him swiþe reufulliche &punctelev; þat he him scholde rede
A ni&yogh;ht an Aungel to is dou&yogh;ter cam &punctelev; and þeos wordes to hire sede
"Ne beo þou nou&yogh;ht a&yogh;ein þis sonde &punctelev; Ake, þine fader forto paye
Graunte iwedded forto beo &punctelev; and bide þat he it delai&yogh;e
Ane þreo &yogh;er, þat þou mouwe þe &yogh;wile &punctelev; þi Maidenhod anoure
And þat huy þe purchace clene maidenes &punctelev; with þe to habbe in þi boure
¶ And þat þe king of Enguelonde and is sone &punctelev; and þi fader beon alle at one rede
Þe forto cheose ten clene Maidenes &punctelev; withoute eche wicke dede
&YOGH;wane &yogh;e Endleue togadere beothþ &punctelev; þat huy eou finden &yogh;eot þerto
Euerech of eov a þousend maidenes &punctelev; to serui eou also
Þat &yogh;wane &yogh;e alle togadere beoth &punctelev; þat ech mouwe in is side
honouri hire Maidenhod and þin &punctelev; þat it beo couth wel wide
So þat Men ne mouwen Maide non &punctelev; alosed finde[finde overlined] a&yogh;ein þe
And þat he wolle cristine bicome &punctelev; þi louerd þat schal beo
In þis foreward graunte him &punctelev; aftur þe þridde &yogh;ere
Ispoused to beon in godes laweâ€” &punctelev; And ne haue þerof no fere!"
Þo þat maide iheorde þis &punctelev; glad heo was of is lore
Þat heo wuste &yogh;warewith heo mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; bringue hire fader of is sore
¶ Sone heo wende to hire fader &punctelev; and bad þat he ire telle scholde
&YOGH;wy þat he so mourninde &yogh;eode. &punctelev; he seide þat he nolde
"Ich wot wel þi þou&yogh;t," þat maide seide &punctelev; "þei þou it holde stille
Of þi sonde ne haue no doute &punctelev; ichulle don al þi wille."
Þo bigan heo tellen him in &yogh;wuche manereâ€” &punctelev; ase þe Aungel hire hadde iseid
heo wolde habbe þene hei&yogh;e Man &punctelev; &yogh;if þat it were is red
¶ Welle, glad was þe kyng &punctelev; þo þat he iheorde þis
Þe Messagers he &yogh;af Answere &punctelev; sone with gret blis
Þo huy [it] brou&yogh;ten þe kingues sone &punctelev; þe tiþingue wel him payde
Sone he liet Baptizen him &punctelev; for loue of þat Maide
And þoru&yogh; is fader and þoru&yogh; him &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; þe oþur kingue
Endleue þousend of clene maidenes &punctelev; to þis maide huy guonne bringue
heo was glad of þe compaygnie &punctelev; þat so fair to hire cam
Sone heo bigan in priueite &punctelev; telle heom of cristinedom
Þat for hire loue and for hire prechingue &punctelev; alle cristine huy were
Louerd, &yogh;wuch a compaygnie &punctelev; of clene maidenes was þere
¶ So gret Ioye þe king of is dou&yogh;ter hadde &punctelev; and of ire faire ferrade
Þat he liet heom makien a quoynte schip &punctelev; of[al. of gret] lengþe and of brede
Þat huy scholden in þe se &punctelev; plei&yogh;e, &yogh;wane huy wolde
Þat ech man alonde and in watere &punctelev; heore maydenhod pre[i]sie scholde
huy sounguen ofte awatere and eke alond &punctelev; and treches huy gonne lede
And oþurmanere faire pleies &punctelev; and al was of clene dedes
Mete and drinke stilleliche &punctelev; to þe schip huy lieten bringue
To þreo &yogh;eres sustinaunce &punctelev; withoute leue of þe kingue
¶ A dai huy wenten into þe se &punctelev; and pleiden heom up and doun
For Ioye þere stoden, to biholden heom &punctelev; Men of mani a toun
Ase huy weren in mest Ioye of plei &punctelev; ore louerd ane wynd sende
Þat drof heom feor into þe se &punctelev; þat men nusten &yogh;wodere huy wende
Welle, glade were þis maydenes þo! &punctelev; þe wind heom drof wel bliue
To[al. ate] þe cite of coloyne &punctelev; formest huy gonne ariue
¶ To Damoysele ourse, þe kyngues dou&yogh;hter &punctelev; an Aungel cam þere
And bad hire lede wel hire compaygnye &punctelev; forto huy imartrede were
And seide þat huy scholden forþere fare &punctelev; and alle a&yogh;ein wende
And in þulke toune for ore louerdes loue &punctelev; imartrede beon atþenende
Glad was þat Mayde for þis word! &punctelev; forthþ huy wenden anon
Atþe cite of Basilie &punctelev; huy ariueden echon
¶ Fram þulke Cite euerechone &punctelev; afote huy wenden to Rome
Gret Ioye made þe pope with heom &punctelev; þo huy þudere come
For manie of heom weren nei&yogh;h him sibbe &punctelev; and for he was of bru|tayne
Cyriac is name was. &punctelev; huy weren of him wel fayne
An Aungel cam to þe pope a ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; and seide þat he scholde
With þis Maydenes imartred beo &punctelev; for ore louerd it so wolde
After þat tyme þis holie man &punctelev; honourede heom þe more
And prechede heom ofte of clannesse &punctelev; and of ore louerdes lore
Tweolf monþe and endleue wokes &punctelev; alle þis Maydenes were
At Rome with þis holie pope &punctelev; þat heom dude wel lere
¶ Ake þe pope seint Ciriac &punctelev; is conseil cleopie gan
His clerkes and is Cardinales &punctelev; and Mani on oþer Man
Bifore heom al is dignete &punctelev; he tok up atþen ende
And seide he wolde into an oþur lond &punctelev; with þis maydenes wende
¶ Þis Cardinales weren þarea&yogh;ein &punctelev; and seiden þat he gan reue
With fole wummen forto go &punctelev; and is dignete bileue
Naþeles he wende forth with heom &punctelev; al a&yogh;ein heore rede
Þe Cardinales and is clerkes &punctelev; gret schame þarefore him seide
Tweie luþere princes þare weren &punctelev; Maximin and Affrican
Þou&yogh;ten þat þis Maydenes wolden &punctelev; tuyrne mani a man
To heore Mey, þe prince of Coloyne &punctelev; huy senden forþenone
Þat he, &yogh;wane huy þudere comen &punctelev; Aslowe heom euerechone
¶ Þat child þat scholde þis Mayde wedde &punctelev; ase heo hadde iseid
Kyng was imaud of Enguelonde &punctelev; þo is fader was ded
Þat ladde swiþe chaste lijf &punctelev; and longuede swiþe sore
With þat clene Maide to speke and beo &punctelev; þoru&yogh; strencþe of godes lore
An Aungel cam to him and bad &punctelev; þat he on alle wise
his Moder and is &yogh;ungueste soster &punctelev; anonri&yogh;ht liete Baptize
And he with heom to Coloygne &punctelev; wiende with al his mayne
A&yogh;ein is trewe spouse, þat was &punctelev; Mayde Ourse of brutayne
Þat heo[r. he] him to hire leide faste &punctelev; in wille and eke in dede
And endede heore lijf in godes seruise &punctelev; ase heo heom wolde rede
¶ þis &yogh;ongue with gret ioye dude &punctelev; þat þe Aungel him gan lere
his moder and is soster he nam &punctelev; þo huy ibaptizede were
And þe Bischop Clement also &punctelev; þat ibaptized heom hadde
Toward coloyne forth with him &punctelev; a&yogh;en þis Maydenes he ladde
Swiþe glad was þis &yogh;ongue king &punctelev; þo he to is lefMan cam
And also glad was þat Maide &punctelev; þo heo sai&yogh;h him in cristinedom
Mest Ioye heo made with is &yogh;ongue soster &punctelev; þat hiet Florentyne
Þat heo, clene Mayde, scholde &punctelev; soffrie deþes pine
¶ Ourse of Brutayne þene &yogh;oungue king &punctelev; in grete Ioye of loue gan lere
Þat he him heolde faste to hire &punctelev; and ne bilefde for no fere
Þat huy mi&yogh;hten in trewe loue &punctelev; togadere imartred beo
And wonye in heuene with Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat bou&yogh;te heom on þe treo
Alþis grauntede þis &yogh;oungue king &punctelev; and is lefmane nou&yogh;t ne wernde
his furste þou&yogh;t into treowe loue &punctelev; and into clannesse he turnde
¶ Þe heþene prince iredi was &punctelev; þo huy to Coloyne come
With manie luþere heþene Men &punctelev; and al þis compaygnie huy nome
And huweden and crieden on heom aschame &punctelev; and to grounde heom aslowe
And ase so fale wolues among lambren &punctelev; heore flechs huy todrowe
Þo huy comen to þis clene þing &punctelev; Maide Ourse of Brutayne
Þat huy founden so fair a creature &punctelev; of hire huy weren wel fayne
Þe prince hire nam and hire bihiet &punctelev; to laten hire gon aliue
And, for heo was so fair and noble &punctelev; habbe hire to wiue
¶ Þis Maide seide þat heo nolde to hire spouse &punctelev; him ne non oþur take
Þe prince nei&yogh;h for wrathþe wod &punctelev; þo he was so fursake
he liet hire to deþe scheote &punctelev; with Aruwene atþenende
And þus heo and al hire compaygnie &punctelev; to þe Ioye of heuene gan wiende
And þe &yogh;ongue king of Enguelonde &punctelev; and is Moder also
And is &yogh;ongue soster Florentine &punctelev; to deþe weren ido
And þe pope Ciriac &punctelev; and Bischopes mani on
Þat for trewe hope of Martyrdom &punctelev; with heom weren igon
Ore louerd hadde swiþe[al. Ou louerd þe] gret Ioye &punctelev; of þat swete ferrede
þat swuch martyrdom for is[al. þi] loue &punctelev; afenguen withoute drede
In þe to hondrede &yogh;ere[al. om.] &punctelev; and ei&yogh;te and þrittiþe &yogh;ere
After ore louerdes buyrtyme &punctelev; þis maidenes imartrede were
¶ Þis endleue þousend of clene maydenes &punctelev; and al þis compaygnie
Iburede weren in Coloyne &punctelev; in one Nonnerie.
An Abbot þere was biside &punctelev; þat heorde of þis cas
And ofte of þis clene Maydenes &punctelev; þat gret Miracle þere was
he bad þe Abbesse of Coloyne &punctelev; þat heo him graunti scholde
A bodi of þis clene Maydenes &punctelev; and he wolde it don in golde
Þo þis bodi was him itake &punctelev; twelf Monþe he liet it beo
Withoute seluer oþur gold &punctelev; in one cheste of treo
¶ Þo þe twelf monþes weren ago &punctelev; ase þe Monekes weren echone
A ny&yogh;t at Matines, þis[MS. þis þis] holie bodi &punctelev; aros hire up allone
heo beu&yogh; hire to þe hei&yogh;e weued &punctelev; and wende mildeliche
Among al þe Couent forthþ &punctelev; and out wel stilledliche.[r. stilleliche]
Þe Monekus, þo huy þis isei&yogh;en &punctelev; ofdradde and sorien[r. sorie] were
huy eoden to þe cheste þare heo [was] inne ileid &punctelev; and ne founden ire nou&yogh;t þere
¶ "Þis," quath þe Abbod, "is ore wreche &punctelev; for we hire ido nadde
In a schrine of gold, ase we biheten &punctelev; þo we ire hidere ladden."
To þe Abbesse of Coloyne &punctelev; þe Abbod wende anon
And tolde þis cas alhou it was &punctelev; of þat Maide igon
huy wenden forthþ to þulke stude &punctelev; þare heo was ileid inne er
And heuen up þe þrouwes lid &punctelev; and founden hire ligge þer
Faire and euene ase heo dude erâ€” &punctelev; so luyte lime þere nas
Þat ne lai ase heo was furst ileid. &punctelev; a fair Miracle þere was
Þe Abbesse was þo swyþe glad &punctelev; and þe Nonnes euerechon
And þonkede god of þat faire Miracle &punctelev; and hei&yogh;e sounguen anon
¶ Þe Abbot bad þat he moste habbe &punctelev; þis holie bodi eftsone
And seide he wolde honouri it faire &punctelev; ase he au&yogh;te forto done
Ake þe Abbesse nolde graunti it nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne þat couent noþur
Þat eft it scholde habbe awei &punctelev; þei he hadde ibeo heore broþur
For buy isei&yogh;en þat it was godes wille &punctelev; þat it bilefde þere
Þis Abbod wende him hom a&yogh;ein &punctelev; with wel dreorie chere
Nou God us graunti, &yogh;if is wille is &punctelev; þat we moten iwinne
Þe hei&yogh;e Ioye of heouene &punctelev; þare alle þis Maydenes beoth inne
Ne þat we neuere þarof ne missen &punctelev; for none[MS. nome] sorie sunne
